intro: Mirabilis gausapoides, commonly known as the pink evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that open in the evening. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Mirabilis gausapoides is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been cultivated for its unique blooming pattern.
